trans-unit.source: Managing Media Services Assets across Multiple Storage Accounts
trans-unit.target: Managing Media Services Assets across Multiple Storage Accounts

trans-unit.source: This articles give you guidance on how to manage media services assets across multiple storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: This articles give you guidance on how to manage media services assets across multiple storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: Managing Media Services Assets across Multiple Storage Accounts
trans-unit.target: Managing Media Services Assets across Multiple Storage Accounts

trans-unit.source: Starting with Microsoft Azure Media Services 2.2, you can attach multiple storage accounts to a single Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Starting with Microsoft Azure Media Services 2.2, you can attach multiple storage accounts to a single Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Ability to attach multiple storage accounts to a Media Services account provides the following benefits:
trans-unit.target: Ability to attach multiple storage accounts to a Media Services account provides the following benefits:

trans-unit.source: Load balancing your assets across multiple storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: Load balancing your assets across multiple storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: Scaling Media Services for large amounts of content processing (as currently a single storage account has a max limit of 500 TB).
trans-unit.target: Scaling Media Services for large amounts of content processing (as currently a single storage account has a max limit of 500 TB).

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how to attach multiple storage accounts to a Media Services account using [Azure Service Management REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee460799.aspx).
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how to attach multiple storage accounts to a Media Services account using [Azure Service Management REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee460799.aspx).

trans-unit.source: It also shows how to specify different storage accounts when creating assets using the Media Services SDK.
trans-unit.target: It also shows how to specify different storage accounts when creating assets using the Media Services SDK.

trans-unit.source: Considerations
trans-unit.target: Considerations

trans-unit.source: When attaching multiple storage accounts to your Media Services account, the following considerations apply:
trans-unit.target: When attaching multiple storage accounts to your Media Services account, the following considerations apply:

trans-unit.source: All storage accounts attached to a Media Services account must be in the same data center as the Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: All storage accounts attached to a Media Services account must be in the same data center as the Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Currently, once a storage account is attached to the specified Media Services account, it cannot be detached.
trans-unit.target: Currently, once a storage account is attached to the specified Media Services account, it cannot be detached.

trans-unit.source: Primary storage account is the one indicated during Media Services account creation time.
trans-unit.target: Primary storage account is the one indicated during Media Services account creation time.

trans-unit.source: Currently, you cannot change the default storage account.
trans-unit.target: Currently, you cannot change the default storage account.

trans-unit.source: Other considerations:
trans-unit.target: Other considerations:

trans-unit.source: Media Services uses the value of the **IAssetFile.Name** property when building URLs for the streaming content (for example, http://{WAMSAccount}.origin.mediaservices.windows.net/{GUID}/{IAssetFile.Name}/streamingParameters.) For this reason, percent-encoding is not allowed.
trans-unit.target: Media Services uses the value of the **IAssetFile.Name** property when building URLs for the streaming content (for example, http://{WAMSAccount}.origin.mediaservices.windows.net/{GUID}/{IAssetFile.Name}/streamingParameters.) For this reason, percent-encoding is not allowed.

trans-unit.source: The value of the Name property cannot have any of the following [percent-encoding-reserved characters](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding#Percent-encoding_reserved_characters): !*'();:@&=+$,/?%#[]".
trans-unit.target: The value of the Name property cannot have any of the following [percent-encoding-reserved characters](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding#Percent-encoding_reserved_characters): !*'();:@&=+$,/?%#[]".

trans-unit.source: Also, there can only be one ‘.’
trans-unit.target: Also, there can only be one ‘.’

trans-unit.source: for the file name extension.
trans-unit.target: for the file name extension.

trans-unit.source: To attach a Storage Account with Azure Service Management REST API
trans-unit.target: To attach a Storage Account with Azure Service Management REST API

trans-unit.source: Currently, the only way to attach multiple storage accounts is by using [Azure Service Management REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee460799.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Currently, the only way to attach multiple storage accounts is by using [Azure Service Management REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee460799.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The code sample in the [How to: Use Media Services Management REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn167656.aspx) topic defines the **AttachStorageAccountToMediaServiceAccount** method that attaches a storage account to the specified Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: The code sample in the [How to: Use Media Services Management REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn167656.aspx) topic defines the **AttachStorageAccountToMediaServiceAccount** method that attaches a storage account to the specified Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: The code in the same topic defines the **ListStorageAccountDetails** method that lists all the storage accounts attached to the specified Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: The code in the same topic defines the **ListStorageAccountDetails** method that lists all the storage accounts attached to the specified Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: To manage Media Services assets across multiple Storage Accounts
trans-unit.target: To manage Media Services assets across multiple Storage Accounts

trans-unit.source: The following code uses the latest Media Services SDK to perform the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: The following code uses the latest Media Services SDK to perform the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Display all the storage accounts associated with the specified Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Display all the storage accounts associated with the specified Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the name of the default storage account.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the name of the default storage account.

trans-unit.source: Create a new asset in the default storage account.
trans-unit.target: Create a new asset in the default storage account.

trans-unit.source: Create an output asset of the encoding job in the specified storage account.
trans-unit.target: Create an output asset of the encoding job in the specified storage account.

trans-unit.target: test
